question_sentence: Joe Biden, Justin Trudeau and which other leader were left out of the G20 summit's group portrait?
evidence: The three leaders turned up for the G20 summit group photo only to find that it had already been taken. US officials played down rumours that Biden missed the shoot to avoid being pictured alongside Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov, and said "logistical issues" had been to blame.

question_sentence: What did we learn this week about how the universe is expanding?
choices: Dark energy no longer affects expansion
Expansion will stop in a billion years
evidence: An international consortium of scientists studying dark energy have found that the universe's expansion may not be constant, as previously believed. Their research suggests that dark energy is acting more like Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity and is changing and weakening over time.

question_sentence: Fans attending early screenings of "Wicked" have been asked to stop doing what?
evidence: Despite the big screen adaptation garnering middling reviews from critics so far, fans of the musical have been letting their appreciation out a little too loudly for fellow viewers' comfort, leading to a debate on social media about audience etiquette. For those who need to let it out, singalong screenings begin on Christmas Day in the US.

question_sentence: Which beloved automobile brand unveiled a controversial rebranding?
evidence: The British carmaker's shift to electric-only vehicles has been overshadowed by a more pedestrian change – the way it writes its name. The firm has "seamlessly blended upper and lower case characters in visual harmony" to refer to itself as "JaGUar". We're not sure, either.

question_sentence: Which US politician paid tribute to former UK deputy PM John Prescott, who died this week, calling him a "dear friend"?
evidence: In a statement, Gore, who was Prescott's US counterpart as vice-president in the Clinton administration, said he would be "forever grateful" for Prescott's role in helping negotiate the Kyoto Protocol on climate change. "I have never worked with anyone in politics – on my side of the pond or his – quite like John Prescott," Gore added.

question_sentence: Which US state struck down the nation's first explicit ban on abortion medication?
evidence: Teton County District Judge Melissa Owens blocked two abortion bans, including the nation's first explicit ban on the use of medication to end pregnancy, saying the laws violated the state constitution's guarantee that adults can make their own healthcare decisions.

question_sentence: The White House has given Ukraine the go-ahead to use which US-supplied missiles for strikes in Russian territory?
evidence: The reversal in policy follows months of lobbying by Volodymyr Zelenskyy and allows Ukrainian forces to fire Army Tactical Missile System rockets beyond its borders towards targets in Russia. Sergei Lavrov, Russia's foreign minister, said the move was a "signal" the West was looking to escalate the conflict.

question_sentence: Which fruit duct-taped to a gallery wall has sold for $6.2 million?
evidence: Maurizio Cattelan's duct-taped artwork, called "Comedian", was initially estimated to sell for $1.5 million. The piece was purchased by Chinese cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun, who plans to eat the banana as part of a "unique artistic experience".

question_sentence: Which singer has objected to the use of their vocals on a new version of "Do They Know It's Christmas"?
evidence: In 2014, the singer-songwriter took part in Band Aid 30, the third recording of the charity single, but has said he was not consulted over the re-use of his voice for Band Aid 40, which will intersperse singers from all three previous versions. Sheeran said his "understanding of the narrative" around the song – which has faced increasing criticism in recent years – had changed.

question_sentence: The voice actor of which Simpsons character announced their retirement?
evidence: Long-time voice actor Pamela Hayden, whose characters also include Sarah Wiggum and school bully Jimbo, has announced her retirement after 35 years and nearly 700 episodes. The show's producers plan to recast the role of Milhouse.

question_sentence: When is the Christiana P.F. Chang's expected to open?
What is one of the top issues identified by Delaware high school basketball coaches?
What was Sarah McBride's response to the proposed House transgender bathroom ban?
choices: She called it a distraction from real issues

question_sentence: What did Matt Walsh do before landing on the Joe Rogan Experience?
choices: She underwent surgery for an artificial limb
She started a new training program

question_sentence: What significant event happened to JoAnn Kenton, the Polytech athletic trainer?
choices: She underwent surgery for an artificial limb
She started a new training program

question_sentence: Why was Harris Jewelry ordered to reopen its claims portal?
choices: It launched a new product line

question_sentence: What is WILMAPCO seeking public comment on?
What was a key message at the Delaware State University BIPOC Farmers Conference?
What is the theme of the new mural project in Wilmington?
When is the Christina School District planning to hold its next referendum to boost funds?
Which severe weather event slammed the Pacific Northwest and Canada's British Columbia this week?
evidence: A deadly bomb cyclone caused a massive power outage on the West Coast this week.

question_sentence: Which of the following is the world’s most polluted city?
evidence: The sky in New Delhi is enveloped with smog, leaving many residents with persistent coughs, lung issues and stinging eyes. As of last week, nowhere else on the planet has air so hazardous to human health, according to global air quality monitors.

question_sentence: Which company recently attempted a test launch of the most powerful rocket ever built?
evidence: SpaceX aborted a highly anticipated booster catch attempt Tuesday during the sixth test of Starship, the most powerful rocket ever built.

question_sentence: Art collectors were clamoring this week for a banana duct-taped to a wall. How much did the piece fetch at a New York auction?
evidence: A conceptual artwork of a duct-taped banana sold for $6.24 million at a Sotheby's auction in New York.

question_sentence: The US government this week formally proposed a partial breakup of which company?
evidence: The Department of Justice formally proposed a partial breakup of Google, targeting the company’s illegal monopoly in search.

question_sentence: Which television personality was selected for a top position in President-elect Donald Trump’s incoming administration?
evidence: Television personality and cardiothoracic surgeon Dr. Mehmet Oz was selected to oversee the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services.

question_sentence: Which country updated its nuclear doctrine this week?
evidence: President Vladimir Putin updated Russia’s military doctrine, saying the revision would in theory lower the bar to first use of nuclear weapons.

question_sentence: Which is the largest and most popular cryptocurrency by market cap?
evidence: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, climbed to record highs in the wake of the US presidential election. Bitcoin topped $70,000 in March and is now trading above $90,000.

question_sentence: Which automaker is changing its iconic logo?
evidence: Jaguar has unveiled a new logo as it transitions into a "new era" that emphasizes its all-electric vehicle lineup.

question_sentence: Headliners were announced for the 2025 Coachella festival this week. Where does the popular music event take place annually?
evidence: The Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival takes place in Southern California. Lady Gaga, Post Malone and Green Day are set to headline the fest in 2025.
